channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked drain, 23rd February
item.description:
There’s a blocked drain hole that leads to road flooding whenever it rains - which has been the case for the last two months. The flooding is a danger for lack of visibility of potholes and increased risk for the tarmac and road surface as well as cars adherence to the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sherborne Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large crater in the middle of the road, 23rd February
item.description:
There is a very large and deep pothole near 92 Petts Wood Road. It’s an actual crater with serious risk of damage to vehicles and injury to bikes and mopeds. The whole road actually needs fixing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of commercial cardboard bin dumped by recycling, 23rd February
item.description:
Loads of boxes from commercial premises from the crodron area. I have pictures of addresses but loads of other boxes that I have not looked at.

item.title: Stolen - Abandoned car?, 23rd February
item.description:
Dark possible audi car parked on corner of cedar/elm Road no number plates front or back and hasn't moved in over a week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cedar Road, Slade Green, Greater London

item.title: 316 Hurst Road has an overgrown hedge blocking the pavement, 23rd February
item.description:
316 Hurst Road has an overgrown hedge blocking the pavement. They have been told about this but refuse to comply. The hedge is blocking the pavement specifically directly in front of the lamppost. Anyone with a wheelchair or a pushchair must go into the road against oncoming traffic to get by
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 316, Hurst Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Matresses for more than a week, 23rd February
item.description:
There are fly tipped mattresses - please pick them up
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tudor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Diagonally opposite the mosque on north side of Chevening Road, 23rd February
item.description:
Tree has caused significant displacement of paving and asphalt causing a major trip hazard which is a danger to elderly residents of the house behind it. They request that the root is shaved so that the pavement can be restored to approximately level as it’s impossible for elderly residents to walk safely.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chevening Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally built annex onto a council property, 23rd February
item.description:
This relates to 296 Hurst Road. It is a council property and the occupants have illegally built an annex (shed) directly on the grass over the last few weeks and extended their garden boundary outwards by about 12ft x 60ft. The grass is a shared communal place and has been taken over by the building works of 296 Hurst Road who also use it as a car park to park their 7 vehicles on of which I have uploaded and provided photographic evidence of.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Shoreham Close, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2ft long pothole, 23rd February
item.description:
Pothole has been here for months. It has caused damage to my car. Tyre blew out with family onboard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Underpass, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside flat 3, Camberley House - Redhill Street NW14AX, 23rd February
item.description:
Someone has vandalised/pulled out the two wooden poles that were fixed there like the others on the pavement and then discarded them in the plants area on Redhill Street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redhill Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on Radbourne Road, 23rd February
item.description:
These potholes are getting progressively worse impacting; Public Safety Risk • Risk to cyclists (deep carriageway defects) • Risk to buses and heavy vehicles losing control • Potential vehicle damage claims Statutory Nuisance • Repeated night-time sleep disturbance • Ongoing vibration transmitted into property • Health impact from sleep deprivation Structural / Property Impact • Internal doors rattling • Fixtures vibrating • Potential long-term building fabric damage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Radbourne Road, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Giant Pothole where roundabout used to be, 23rd February
item.description:
There is a giant pothole where the roundabout used to be. There are also smaller potholes on the surround area of the road which makes it quite dangerous to drive around as people are trying to avoid them meaning they are not driving around the roundabout correctly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bickley Park Road, Bickley, Greater London

item.title: Dangerous obstructive parking, 23rd February
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked here blocking the entrance/exit to our Close for a couple of days. It obstructs the view when exiting the close in a vehicle, making pulling out very dangerous. It is also likely to block the bin lorries entering our Close tomorrow morning, meaning 31 residences will not have their rubbish collected this week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99-105, Lawrie Park Gardens, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
